data.question: What is the product of reaction b in Scheme 1 when solutions of 2 react with SnBuCl in CH2Cl2 at room temperature?
What bond is cleaved in the conversion of 1 to 3?
What type of bond is created in the conversion of 1 to 3?
Is the Mo-Cl bond altered in the conversion of 1 to 3?
data.answer: No, the Mo-Cl bond remains unaltered

data.question: What would be the result of a complete reductive elimination in the reaction of [Mo(CO)2(tBu-dab)(SnCl2)(Cl)] with an isocyanide CNR'?
data.answer: The formation of SnBuCl and the Mo complex A

data.question: What is the expected final product of the complete oxidative addition of SnBuCl to 2?
Is compound 3 considered an intermediate in both the oxidative addition and the reductive elimination of SnBuCl at molybdenum(0) centers?
What prevents the complete reductive elimination of the SnBuCl group in compound 3?
What is the yield of 3a from reaction a?
What is the yield of the product from reaction b?
Does the reaction product 3 have a direct Mo-Sn bond?
Is the Mo-Cl bond in compound 3 formed as a result of reaction b?
Are the two metals in compound 3 held together by the bridging S2CPR2 ligand?
Can S2CPR2 adducts behave as ligands in other homo- or heterodinuclear systems?
What is the role of CS2 in reaction a?
data.answer: It is added to the solution

data.question: What is the role of PCy3 in the experimental procedure for reaction a?
data.answer: It is added to the mixture

data.question: Is the solvent evaporated after the addition of SnBuCl in reaction b?
What is the method used for the crystal structure investigation of 3a?
Are the hydrogen atoms in the molecule of 3a refined anisotropically in the crystal structure investigation?
data.answer: No, all nonhydrogen atoms in the molecule of 3a were refined anisotropically

data.question: Is the Mo-Cl ... Sn bridge in compound 3 considered strong?
